body: In March 2020 the global dash for cash forced investors to liquidate gold futures alongside equities as funding markets seized. The Federal Reserve opened dollar swap lines and unlimited asset purchases, calming liquidity stress. Once policy support gained traction, gold rebounded from 1450 dollars per ounce to new highs above 2000 by August as real yields collapsed and fiscal stimulus surged. The sequence emphasised that initial liquidity shocks can push bullion lower before reflation narratives dominate.
